result.reason: Users want to hide connection tab strip for RDCMan-like workflow; existing AlwaysShowPanelTabs infrastructure is already in place and HideAlways mode exists but is commented out
result.approach: Expose a 'Hide connection tabs' option in TabsPanels settings page (inverse of AlwaysShowPanelTabs or a new setting). When enabled, set TabController.HideTabsMode to HideAlways on all ConnectionWindows. The DockPanel already supports HideTabsModes — uncomment and wire the existing HideAlways path in ConnectionWindow.cs and frmMain.cs, add UI checkbox in TabsPanelsPage.

Now I have a clear picture. The issue requests the ability to hide connection tabs. The codebase already has `AlwaysShowPanelTabs` which controls tab visibility, but there's a commented-out `HideTabsMode = HideAlways` in ConnectionWindow.cs. The feature is essentially about adding a "hide tabs" option (the inverse of "always show panel tabs"). Looking at the existing code, there's already infrastructure for this - `AlwaysShowPanelTabs` exists and `HideTabsModes.HideAlways` is available but commented out. The original author even submitted a PR that was merged but got lost during the MagicLib removal.
